result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:16 AM Defendant Samuel J. Bush appeared by video.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Samuel J. Bush.  Attorney Crystal Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He has counsel   Waive reading of the complaint.  STC set for 10/3 3PM  
Attorney Sebion requests this case track with his current open cases. 22CF113 & 22CF116.  State has no objection to  placing this case on STC for 10/3 it may need a PTC can address on 10/3.  Sign bond by 9/29 at 4pm.
